steps.name: Positive Balances
steps.content: If an account has supplied assets to the protocol (i.e., it has a positive balance), its present balance is calculated using the base supply index.

steps.name: Formula
steps.content:
Balance= Principal×BaseSupplyIndex

Here, "Principal" represents the amount of assets supplied by the account, and "BaseSupplyIndex" represents the current global index for supply.

steps.name: Negative Balances
steps.content: If an account has borrowed assets from the protocol (i.e., it has a negative balance), its present balance is calculated using the base borrow index.

steps.name: Formula
steps.content:
Balance= Principal×BaseBorrowIndex

Here, "Principal" represents the amount of assets borrowed by the account, and "BaseBorrowIndex" represents the current global index for borrow.
